newsitem.title: ITALY: UN agency appeals for urgent aid for Tajikistan.
newsitem.headline: UN agency appeals for urgent aid for Tajikistan.

text.p: The U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) appealed on Friday for emergency food aid for half a million people in Tajikistan hit by civil war and economic collapse.
"Without relief food assistance there is a real risk of acute malnutrition and even starvation in some areas," the Rome-based food aid agency said in a statement.

It called on the international community for contributions totalling just over $16 million to feed 500,000 people for one year as part of a continuing programme of emergency assistance for the central Asian former Soviet republic.

It said the aid would go to 485,000 pensioners with families, poor single-parent families, orphans, the disabled and invalids. The remaining aid would be distributed to 15,000 people in food-for-work schemes.

WFP said basic food prices had gone up by more than 500 percent since May 1995 and Tajikistan had been unable to import sufficient cereals because of a sharp drop in production of cotton and aluminium, its main barter commodities.
Tajikistan is still reeling from a four-year civil war in which tens of thousands of people were killed. Armed groups still roam the mountainous state, which borders Afghanistan and China.
